page.title: 11North common lane
page.content: Our lane is called North Common Lane.The lane was used as a way of avoiding paying a toll at Earldoms.The carriages went past our house,right out of Scotland Lane,and back to the main road.Our house is called Cobweb Cottage and the house next door to us is called Hawkwind Cottage.These weren't the original names because our house was called North Common Cottage.Our house used to be a shoe makers house and before that a gardener's house and before that a farm worker's cottage.It used to be two houses but now it is one.On the old woodwork you can see nail marks from where the tools were kept.The house has a thatched roof and has two original fireplaces.Our kitchen was one cottage and measures 9 by 12 feet with a bedroom above.
